answers.answer: HIV test results overrule everything else, as long as testing is done long enough after the last possible exposure. No matter the symptoms and no matter how high risk the exposure at the time, your negative HIV tests prove conclusively you do not have HIV. Continue to work with your doctor about your possible thrush and other symptoms, but HIV isn't the problem.
